results.title: Noise pollution
results.brief_description: Combines physics, biology and meteorology to study the effects of noise as impairment to the ear, psychological harm to the individual, physical damage to structures and changes in ecology.

results.title: Noise not sound
results.brief_description: Distinguishes between natural sounds of the environment and excessive, harmful sounds made by humans. Defines sound pollution, tracing historical background, scientific experimentaiton and solutions to sound pollution. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Noise [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Benz, Louise Gartland and Sentinel Films
results.brief_description: A noisy street sweeper hinders the sleep of a man lying in bed. Add to the mix a noisy car reverse parallel parking and the ensuing car alarm as strangers become friends in their unity to stop the noise.

results.title: Noise
results.creator_credit: Don Dickerson and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: Raises such questions as: What is the difference between sound and noise? How does noise effect the individual? As the tempo of urban life increases, must the amount of noise also increase? Explores the effect of noise on the daily activities of a family at home, at school, at work, and indicates ways to control noise. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Noi Tre
results.creator_credit: Pupi Avati, Antonio Avati, Duea Film, Istituto Luce Italnoleggio Cinematografico and Rai Uno Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: One of the most delightful films ever made about Mozart, “Noi Tre” is also a delicate and touching study of the last moments of childhood, as the 14 year old prodigy spends summer with his father on Count Pallavicini’s estate preparing for an important exam at the Bologna Philharmonic Academy. However, in between his studies he falls in with the local boys of his own age, and also feels the first stirring’s of love for Antonia, a girl from a nearby villa. Tasting for the first time, the life of a normal 14 year old, Mozart decides to fail the exam.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pupi Avati, Antonio Avati, Duea Film, Istituto Luce Italnoleggio Cinematografico and Rai Uno Radiotelevisione Italiana

results.title: Noddy goes to school
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Mark Hall, CPL and Stop Frame Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the Noddy stories by Enid Blyton. A series of incidents cause Noddy to come to the realisation that he should go to school to learn to read. Narrated by Richard Briers.

results.title: Noddy gets into trouble (K)
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Mark Hall, CPL and Stop Frame Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the Noddy stories by Enid Blyton. Noddy feels he is starting an “extra special” day and then finds he is suspected of theft of cakes and tarts because his cap bell was heard at the scene. The townspeople shun him as further thefts occur, but in the end, with the help of Big Ears and Little Ears, Noddy captures the real thief and presents him to Mr Plodd the Policeman. Narrated by Richard Briers.

results.title: Noddy be brave (K)
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Mark Hall, CPL and Stop Frame Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the Noddy stories by Enid Blyton. Noddy is looking forward to visiting Big Ears on his day off, but a car accident means he must find alternative transport for his taxi service. While Noddy’s car is in the shop, Mr Honk from Car Town starts up his own taxi service in Toy Town. Noddy and Big Ears must devise a plan! Narrated by Richard Briers.

results.title: Noddy and Tessie Bear (K)
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Mark Hall, CPL and Stop Frame Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the Noddy stories by Enid Blyton. Noddy helps Tessie Bear sell her eggs on market day after which they then buy a kite to fly in the strong wind, in a nearby farmer’s paddock. They tie the kite to a milk churn and a basket full of eggs, and the kite lifts the milk and eggs aloft raining milk and eggs on the market before eventually Noddy comes to the rescue. Narrated by Richard Briers.

results.title: Nobody gets out of this band alive
results.brief_description: The Spinning Wheels were an Australian band that played in the mid 60s. They were heavily influenced by early Rolling Stones and took to playing covers by Muddy Waters, Bo Diddley, Chuck Berry and Jimmy Reed. Their version of Muddy Water’s ‘Got my mojo working” became a Top 10 Australian hit. Legendary radio disc jockey Stan ‘The Man’ Rofe said that the band paved the way for rock and roll’s popularity in Melbourne. However, the band failed to release an album until the year 2000. This video shows The Spinning Wheels playing two sets at their album launch at the Melbourne rock and roll venue The Tote. The show was compared by Rofe and features an excellent set by garage rockers The Breadmakers. The sound quality is OK and the picture quality plain as it is only one camera, however, fans of The Spinning Wheels, The Breadmakers, and of early Australian rock and roll would find this video worth checking out. No production details available.
